greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: Number of ordered ways to write n = x*(x+1)/2 + y with y*(y+1)/2 + 1 prime, where x and y are nonnegative integers.
comment: Conjecture: a(n) > 0 for all n > 0. Moreover, if n > 0 is not among 1, 3, 60, then there are positive integers x and y with x*(x+1)/2 + y = n such that y*(y+1)/2 + 1 is prime.
reference: Zhi-Wei Sun, On sums of primes and triangular numbers, J. Comb. Number Theory 1(2009), no.1, 65-76.
link: Zhi-Wei Sun, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
Zhi-Wei Sun, Conjectures involving primes and quadratic forms, preprint, arXiv:1211.1588.
results.author: _Zhi-Wei Sun_, Oct 15 2013
